embeds.title: Wander Bots
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

At the start of each combat, lose 1 Stasis slot.
Gain :energy_guardian: at the start of your turn.
*These drones find the most wonderful salvage, but require processing power to maintain.*

messages.content: this is a relic

like absorb decks

feel like that relic was really strong pre reformation rework but now its one of the relics ever

yeah but that 1 less passive slime might hurt slightly
I feel like most runs this is nearly a free energy relic for me.
I mean <growth power slimeboss> is way better than <fasting> comparatively

embeds.title: Grow
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 (1) :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Lose 1 Slime slot in exchange for 2 **Strength** :p_strength: and 2 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: and this has like
3X value of grow
wander bots and tarr blob will switch places lmao
It's worth it except for the few times it isn't, but the nerf would only effect the decks dabbling in slimes. I think -2 slots would be fine.
how?
wander bots used to be -2 stasis slots

Quite a strong energy relic for slime boss, losing a slime slot, as has been mentioned with grow, is really not that bad, and could even be considered an upside if you are trying to access the strength gain from absorbing slimes. Unless you are really going all in on potency, or have several cards that care about the number of slimes you have summoned, this is a very acceptable tradeoff for the 4th energy. Unrelated, but is there a reason it's spelled tarr instead of tar?
Could be a Slime Rancher refrence
yeah slime rancher refrence
||In slime rancher if a slime tries to become a combination of 3 slimes it becomes a Tarr instead||
tarrs are hostile black colored slimes
so that's why it makes you lose a slime slot
Yeah basically you cross-breed slimes to then sell their poop. Try and cross-breed them too much they try and kill you.
Yep
<Slime boss play top card repeat for every>

embeds.title: Idol of Retromation
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of your turn, reduce the cost of the most expensive card in your hand by 1 for this turn.
*Often called the Idol of Reto for short.*

footer.text: <boss relic reduce cost highest> = idol of retromation, 83.67

messages.content: Unfortunately most people play slime as the lick recursion character which is what makes tarr blob so effective as a swap in the first place
I just did lick recursion and then died to watcherclad neow
And usually when you run that type of deck grow is going to be more important than a slime slot
Energy aswell
Lack of damage or block?
just died to the 99 flat out
Damn
damage was good enough and so was block but it was too slow
even with two just deserts and a toxic egg
watcherclad moment
I'm a fan of leeching with lots of command as a blocking engine
You can also just draft very little attacks and allow leeching strike to be a blocking engine

this is any energy relic that has ether a negligible drawback or is the worst one downside possible; it just all depends on your deck. The value of 3 slime slots is only stronger then an extra energy if you have built into summon slime synergies. In normal decks just having 2, or even 1 slime slots is plenty since that gives you enough room to use a one of copy of mire slime, brusier slime or a specialty slime; as well as making split not a dead card. Given that slime boss most of the time is not using slime based synergies in favor of the easier to acquire goop, tackle and stalling strategies this relic ends up being pickable quite often, but slime strategy are very powerful and this relic can block you out of them (much like a velvet choker can).

I feel like this relic is either an instant take or an instant skip. I think if it was -2 it would possibly deter people from taking it even if they aren't relying on slimes as much, and I think this is the right direction. On runs where you don't care about slimes, this is a free energy relic. Up there with Reto idol.
